result.execSummary:
The defendant Everett D Bourn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 90 days or serve 5 days jail, consecutive for non payment of fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Everett D Bourn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Everett D Bourn did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State moves to amend the charge to a county ordinance 13-102(c)(8).  The Court amends the charge and finds the Defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows: 
FINE: $236.00 (to be paid in 90 days or serve 5 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment of fine.)

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Everett D Bourn did not appear.     Attorney appears by authorization.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco advises the Court that the Defendant has moved to St. Louis and there is a fine only recommendation.  The Court sets the matter for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Everett D Bourn did not appear.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Bricco advises the Court she has received discover and an offer and requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant to have no violant contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Everett D Bourn in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Everett D Bourn
Current: 117 Berkshire Drive, Belleville, IL 62223 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2015)
Prior: 1165 White Rock Ave,#6, Waukesha, WI 53186
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
